member.name: T:org.pdfclown.objects.PdfObjectWrapper`1
member.summary: High-level representation of a strongly-typed PDF object.

remarks.para: Specialized objects don't inherit directly from their low-level counterparts (e.g. Contents extends PdfStream, Pages extends PdfArray and so on) because there's no plain one-to-one mapping between primitive PDF types and specialized instances: the Content entry of Page dictionaries may be a simple reference to a PdfStream or a PdfArray of references to PdfStreams, Pages collections may be spread across a B-tree instead of a flat PdfArray and so on.

So, in order to hide all these annoying inner workings, I chose to adopt a composition pattern instead of the apparently-reasonable (but actually awkward!) inheritance pattern. Nonetheless, users can navigate through the low-level structure getting the BaseDataObject backing this object.

member.summary: Abstract specialized graphic object.

summary.para: It provides common ways to convert any content into content stream objects.

member.name: M:org.pdfclown.documents.contents.IContentEntity.ToInlineObject(org.pdfclown.documents.contents.composition.PrimitiveComposer)
member.summary: Converts this entity to its equivalent inline (dependent) object representation [PDF:1.6:4.8.6].

remarks.para: This method creates and shows an inline object within the target content context, returning it.
Due to its direct-content nature (opposite to the indirect-content nature of external objects), the resulting object should be shown only one time in order not to wastefully duplicate its data.

member.returns: The inline object representing the entity.

member.name: M:org.pdfclown.documents.contents.IContentEntity.ToXObject(org.pdfclown.documents.Document)
member.summary: Converts this entity to its equivalent external (independent) object representation [PDF:1.6:4.7].

remarks.para: This method creates an external object within the target document, returning it. To show it in a content context (eg: a page), then it must be applied in an appropriate manner (see PrimitiveComposer object).

member.returns: The external object representing the entity.

member.name: P:org.pdfclown.documents.contents.entities.Barcode.Code
member.summary: Gets the code to represent.

members.member:
EAN-13 Bar Code object [GS1:7.1:5.1.1.3.1].
The EAN-13 Bar Code Symbol shall be made up as follows, reading from left to right:
A left Quiet Zone
A normal Guard Bar Pattern (Left Guard)
Six symbol characters from number sets A and B (Left Half)
A center Guard Bar Pattern (Center Guard)
Six symbol characters from number set C (Right Half)
A normal Guard Bar Pattern (Right Guard)
A right Quiet Zone
The rightmost symbol character shall encode the Check Digit.

Symbol Character Encodation (Number Set A, odd parity) [GS1:7.1:5.1.1.2.1]. NOTE: Number Set B uses the same patterns (though at inverted parity, i.e. even), whilst Number Set C (even parity) mirrors Number Set B.

Left Half of an EAN-13 Bar Code Symbol. Since the EAN-13 Bar Code Symbol comprises only 12 symbol characters but encodes 13 digits of data (including the Check Digit), the value of the additional digit (leading digit, implicitly encoded), which is the character in the leftmost position in the data string, shall be encoded by the variable parity mix of number sets A and B for the six symbol characters in the left half of the symbol.

member.name: T:org.pdfclown.documents.contents.ContentScanner
member.summary: Content objects scanner.

remarks.para: It wraps the content objects collection to scan its graphics state through a forward cursor.

Scanning is performed at an arbitrary deepness, according to the content objects nesting: each depth level corresponds to a scan level so that at any time it's possible to seamlessly navigate across the levels (see , ).

members.member: Current object index at this level.
Device-space size of the rendering canvas.

member.summary: Print the annotation when the page is printed.

member.summary: Do not allow the annotation to interact with the user.

member.name: T:org.pdfclown.documents.interaction.forms.Field.FlagsEnum
member.summary: Field flags [PDF:1.6:8.6.2].

member.name: F:org.pdfclown.documents.interaction.forms.Field.FlagsEnum.ReadOnly
member.summary: The user may not change the value of the field.

member.name: F:org.pdfclown.documents.interaction.forms.Field.FlagsEnum.Required
member.summary: The field must have a value at the time it is exported by a submit-form action.

member.name: F:org.pdfclown.documents.interaction.forms.Field.FlagsEnum.NoExport
member.summary: The field must not be exported by a submit-form action.

member.name: F:org.pdfclown.documents.interaction.forms.Field.FlagsEnum.Multiline
member.summary: (Text fields only) The field can contain multiple lines of text.

member.name: F:org.pdfclown.documents.interaction.forms.Field.FlagsEnum.Password
member.summary: (Text fields only) The field is intended for entering a secure password that should not be echoed visibly to the screen.

member.name: F:org.pdfclown.documents.interaction.forms.Field.FlagsEnum.NoToggleToOff
member.summary: (Radio buttons only) Exactly one radio button must be selected at all times.

member.name: F:org.pdfclown.documents.interaction.forms.Field.FlagsEnum.Radio
member.summary: (Button fields only) The field is a set of radio buttons (otherwise, a check box).
member.remarks: This flag is meaningful only if the Pushbutton flag isn't selected.

member.name: F:org.pdfclown.documents.interaction.forms.Field.FlagsEnum.Pushbutton
member.summary: (Button fields only) The field is a pushbutton that does not retain a permanent value.

member.name: F:org.pdfclown.documents.interaction.forms.Field.FlagsEnum.Combo
member.summary: (Choice fields only) The field is a combo box (otherwise, a list box).

member.name: F:org.pdfclown.documents.interaction.forms.Field.FlagsEnum.Edit
member.summary: (Choice fields only) The combo box includes an editable text box as well as a dropdown list (otherwise, it includes only a drop-down list).

member.name: F:org.pdfclown.documents.interaction.forms.Field.FlagsEnum.Sort
member.summary: (Choice fields only) The field's option items should be sorted alphabetically.

member.name: F:org.pdfclown.documents.interaction.forms.Field.FlagsEnum.FileSelect
member.summary: (Text fields only) Text entered in the field represents the pathname of a file whose contents are to be submitted as the value of the field.

member.name: F:org.pdfclown.documents.interaction.forms.Field.FlagsEnum.MultiSelect
member.summary: (Choice fields only) More than one of the field's option items may be selected simultaneously.

member.name: F:org.pdfclown.documents.interaction.forms.Field.FlagsEnum.DoNotSpellCheck
member.summary: (Choice and text fields only) Text entered in the field is not spell-checked.

member.name: F:org.pdfclown.documents.interaction.forms.Field.FlagsEnum.DoNotScroll
member.summary: (Text fields only) The field does not scroll to accommodate more text than fits within its annotation rectangle.
member.remarks: Once the field is full, no further text is accepted.

member.name: F:org.pdfclown.documents.interaction.forms.Field.FlagsEnum.Comb
member.summary: (Text fields only) The field is automatically divided into as many equally spaced positions, or combs, as the value of MaxLen, and the text is laid out into those combs.

member.name: F:org.pdfclown.documents.interaction.forms.Field.FlagsEnum.RichText
member.summary: (Text fields only) The value of the field should be represented as a rich text string.

member.name: F:org.pdfclown.documents.interaction.forms.Field.FlagsEnum.RadiosInUnison
member.summary: (Button fields only) A group of radio buttons within a radio button field that use the same value for the on state will turn on and off in unison (otherwise, the buttons are mutually exclusive).

member.name: F:org.pdfclown.documents.interaction.forms.Field.FlagsEnum.CommitOnSelChange
member.summary: (Choice fields only) The new value is committed as soon as a selection is made with the pointing device.

member.name: T:org.pdfclown.objects.IPdfNamedObjectWrapper
member.summary: High-level representation of a PDF object that can be referenced also through a name.

remarks.para: Some categories of objects in a PDF file can be also referred to by name rather than by object reference. The correspondence between names and objects is established by the document's name dictionary [PDF:1.6:3.6.3].
The name's purpose is to provide a further level of referential abstraction especially for references across diverse PDF documents.

member.name: P:org.pdfclown.objects.IPdfNamedObjectWrapper.Name
member.summary: Gets the object name.
member.remarks: As names are tipically loosely-coupled with their corresponding PDF objects, name retrieval implies a costly reverse lookup into the document's name tree.

member.summary: Two lines sweep across the screen, revealing the page.

member.name: F:org.pdfclown.documents.interaction.navigation.page.Transition.StyleEnum.Blinds
member.summary: Multiple lines sweep across the screen, revealing the page.

member.summary: A rectangular box sweeps between the edges of the page and the center.

member.summary: A single line sweeps across the screen from one edge to the other.

member.name: F:org.pdfclown.documents.interaction.navigation.page.Transition.StyleEnum.Dissolve
member.summary: The old page dissolves gradually.

member.name: F:org.pdfclown.documents.interaction.navigation.page.Transition.StyleEnum.Glitter
member.summary: The old page dissolves gradually sweeping across the page in a wide band moving from one side of the screen to the other.

member.summary: No transition.

member.name: F:org.pdfclown.documents.interaction.navigation.page.Transition.StyleEnum.Fly
member.summary: Changes are flown across the screen.

member.name: F:org.pdfclown.documents.interaction.navigation.page.Transition.StyleEnum.Push
member.summary: The page slides in, pushing away the old one.

member.name: F:org.pdfclown.documents.interaction.navigation.page.Transition.StyleEnum.Cover
member.summary: The page slides on to the screen, covering the old one.

member.summary: The old page slides off the screen, uncovering the new one.

member.name: F:org.pdfclown.documents.interaction.navigation.page.Transition.StyleEnum.Fade

member.name: P:org.pdfclown.documents.Page.BleedBox
member.summary: Gets/Sets the region to which the contents of the page should be clipped when output in a production environment [PDF:1.7:10.10.1].

remarks.para: This may include any extra bleed area needed to accommodate the physical limitations of cutting, folding, and trimming equipment. The actual printed page may include printing marks that fall outside the bleed box.

member.name: P:org.pdfclown.documents.Page.CropBox
member.summary: Gets/Sets the region to which the contents of the page are to be clipped (cropped) when displayed or printed [PDF:1.7:10.10.1].

remarks.para: Unlike the other boxes, the crop box has no defined meaning in terms of physical page geometry or intended use; it merely imposes clipping on the page contents. However, in the absence of additional information, the crop box determines how the page's contents are to be positioned on the output medium.

member.name: P:org.pdfclown.documents.Page.Duration
member.summary: Gets/Sets the page's display duration.

remarks.para: The page's display duration (also called its advance timing) is the maximum length of time, in seconds, that the page is displayed during presentations before the viewer application automatically advances to the next page.
By default, the viewer does not advance automatically.

member.name: T:org.pdfclown.documents.PageFormat.SizeEnum
member.summary: Paper size.
member.remarks:
References:
{ 'A' digit+ }: [ISO 216] "A" series: Paper and boards, trimmed sizes.
{ 'B' digit+ }: [ISO 216] "B" series: Posters, wall charts and similar items.
{ 'C' digit+ }: [ISO 269] "C" series: Envelopes or folders suitable for A-size stationery.
{ 'Ansi' letter }: [ANSI/ASME Y14.1] ANSI series: US engineering drawing series.
{ 'Arch' letter }: Architectural series.
{ "Letter", "Legal", "Executive", "Statement", "Tabloid" }: Traditional north-american sizes.

member.name: T:org.pdfclown.files.IndirectObjects
member.summary: Collection of the alive indirect objects available inside the file.

remarks.para: According to the PDF spec, indirect object entries may be free (no data object associated) or in-use (data object associated).

We can effectively subdivide indirect objects in two possibly-overriding collections: the original indirect objects (coming from the associated preexisting file) and the newly-registered indirect objects (coming from new data objects or original indirect objects manipulated during the current session).

To ensure that the modifications applied to an original indirect object are committed to being persistent is critical that the modified original indirect object is newly-registered (practically overriding the original indirect object).
Alive indirect objects encompass all the newly-registered ones plus not-overridden original ones.

member.name: F:org.pdfclown.files.IndirectObjects.file
member.summary: Associated file.

member.name: F:org.pdfclown.files.IndirectObjects.importedObjects
member.summary: Map of matching references of imported indirect objects.

remarks.para: This collection is used to prevent duplications among imported indirect objects.
Key is the external indirect object hashcode, Value is the matching internal indirect object.

member.remarks: This collection is used as a cache to avoid unconsistent parsing duplications.

member.returns: The number of entries available in the collection.

member.name: T:org.pdfclown.files.SerializationModeEnum
member.summary: PDF file serialization mode [PDF:1.6:3.4].

member.name: F:org.pdfclown.files.SerializationModeEnum.Standard
member.summary: Standard complete file serialization [PDF:1.6:3.4].
member.remarks: It writes the entire file, generating a single-section cross-reference table and removing obsolete data structures. It reduces the serialization size, but it's more computationally-intensive (slower).

member.name: F:org.pdfclown.files.SerializationModeEnum.Incremental
member.summary: Standard incremental file serialization [PDF:1.6:2.2.7].
member.remarks: It leaves original contents intact, appending changes to the end of the file along with an additional cross-reference table section. It increases the serialization size, but it's faster.

member.name: F:org.pdfclown.files.SerializationModeEnum.Linearized
member.summary: Linearized file serialization [PDF:1.6:F].
member.remarks: It organizes the file to enable efficient incremental access in a network environment. It increases the serialization size and it's more computationally-intensive (slower).

member.remarks: When a separation space with this component name is the current color space, painting operators apply tint values to all available components at once.

member.summary: Uncolored tiling pattern ("stencil") associated to a color.

member.name: P:org.pdfclown.documents.contents.colorSpaces.TilingPattern.Colorized.Color
member.summary: Gets the color applied to the stencil.

member.name: T:org.pdfclown.documents.contents.colorSpaces.TilingPattern.PaintTypeEnum
member.summary: Pattern cell color mode.

member.name: F:org.pdfclown.documents.contents.colorSpaces.TilingPattern.PaintTypeEnum.Colored
member.summary: The pattern's content stream specifies the colors used to paint the pattern cell.
member.remarks: When the content stream begins execution, the current color is the one that was initially in effect in the pattern's parent content stream.

member.name: F:org.pdfclown.documents.contents.colorSpaces.TilingPattern.PaintTypeEnum.Uncolored
member.summary: The pattern's content stream does NOT specify any color information.

remarks.para: Instead, the entire pattern cell is painted with a separately specified color each time the pattern is used; essentially, the content stream describes a stencil through which the current color is to be poured.
The content stream must not invoke operators that specify colors or other color-related parameters in the graphics state.

members.member: Spacing adjustment of tiles relative to the device pixel grid.

member.name: F:org.pdfclown.documents.contents.colorSpaces.TilingPattern.TilingTypeEnum.ConstantSpacing
member.summary: Pattern cells are spaced consistently, that is by a multiple of a device pixel.

member.name: F:org.pdfclown.documents.contents.colorSpaces.TilingPattern.TilingTypeEnum.VariableSpacing
member.summary: The pattern cell is not distorted, but the spacing between pattern cells may vary by as much as 1 device pixel, both horizontally and vertically, when the pattern is painted.

member.name: F:org.pdfclown.documents.contents.colorSpaces.TilingPattern.TilingTypeEnum.FasterConstantSpacing
member.summary: Pattern cells are spaced consistently as in tiling type 1 but with additional distortion permitted to enable a more efficient implementation.

member.summary: Shading object [PDF:1.6:4.6.3].

member.name: T:org.pdfclown.documents.contents.composition.PrimitiveComposer

summary.para: It provides the basic (primitive) operations described by the PDF specification for graphics content composition.

member.remarks: This class leverages the object-oriented content stream modelling infrastructure, which encompasses 1st-level content stream objects (operations), 2nd-level content stream objects (graphics objects) and full graphics state support.

member.summary: Applies a transformation to the coordinate system from user space to device space [PDF:1.6:4.3.3].
member.remarks: The transformation is applied to the current transformation matrix (CTM) by concatenation, i.e. it doesn't replace it.

member.name: T:org.pdfclown.tokens.PdfEncoding
member.summary: PDF serialization encoding [PDF:1.6:3.1].
member.remarks: PDF can be entirely represented using byte values corresponding to the visible printable subset of the ASCII character set, plus white space characters such as space, tab, carriage return, and line feed characters. However, a PDF file is not restricted to the ASCII character set; it can contain arbitrary 8-bit bytes.

member.name: T:org.pdfclown.documents.contents.BlendModeEnum
member.summary: Blend mode to be used in the transparent imaging model [PDF:1.7:7.2.4].

member.name: F:org.pdfclown.documents.contents.BlendModeEnum.Normal
member.summary: Select the source color, ignoring the backdrop.

member.name: F:org.pdfclown.documents.contents.BlendModeEnum.Multiply
member.summary: Multiply the backdrop and source color values.

member.name: F:org.pdfclown.documents.contents.BlendModeEnum.Screen
member.summary: Multiply the complements of the backdrop and source color values, then complement the result.

member.name: F:org.pdfclown.documents.contents.BlendModeEnum.Overlay
member.summary: Multiply or screen the colors, depending on the backdrop color value.

member.name: F:org.pdfclown.documents.contents.BlendModeEnum.Darken
member.summary: Select the darker of the backdrop and source colors.

member.name: F:org.pdfclown.documents.contents.BlendModeEnum.Lighten
member.summary: Select the lighter of the backdrop and source colors.

member.name: F:org.pdfclown.documents.contents.BlendModeEnum.ColorDodge
member.summary: Brighten the backdrop color to reflect the source color.

member.name: F:org.pdfclown.documents.contents.BlendModeEnum.ColorBurn
member.summary: Darken the backdrop color to reflect the source color.

member.name: F:org.pdfclown.documents.contents.BlendModeEnum.HardLight
member.summary: Multiply or screen the colors, depending on the source color value.

member.name: F:org.pdfclown.documents.contents.BlendModeEnum.SoftLight
member.summary: Darken or lighten the colors, depending on the source color value.

member.name: F:org.pdfclown.documents.contents.BlendModeEnum.Difference
member.summary: Subtract the darker of the two constituent colors from the lighter color.

member.name: F:org.pdfclown.documents.contents.BlendModeEnum.Exclusion
member.summary: Produce an effect similar to that of the Difference mode but lower in contrast.

member.name: F:org.pdfclown.documents.contents.BlendModeEnum.Hue
member.summary: Create a color with the hue of the source color and the saturation and luminosity of the backdrop color.

member.name: F:org.pdfclown.documents.contents.BlendModeEnum.Saturation
member.summary: Create a color with the saturation of the source color and the hue and luminosity of the backdrop color.

member.name: F:org.pdfclown.documents.contents.BlendModeEnum.Color
member.summary: Create a color with the hue and saturation of the source color and the luminosity of the backdrop color.

member.name: F:org.pdfclown.documents.contents.BlendModeEnum.Luminosity
member.summary: Create a color with the luminosity of the source color and the hue and saturation of the backdrop color.

member.summary: Gets/Sets the minimum requirements the renderer must honor in order to be considered viable.

member.summary: Media player parameters viability.

member.name: P:org.pdfclown.documents.multimedia.MediaPlayParameters.Viability.Autoplay
member.summary: Gets/Sets whether the media should automatically play when activated.

member.name: P:org.pdfclown.documents.multimedia.MediaPlayParameters.Viability.Duration
member.summary: Gets/Sets the temporal duration, corresponding to the notion of simple duration in SMIL.

list.item: Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY: intrinsic duration of the associated media;

member.name: P:org.pdfclown.documents.multimedia.MediaPlayParameters.Viability.FitMode
member.summary: Gets/Sets the manner in which the player should treat a visual media type that does not exactly fit the rectangle in which it plays.

member.name: P:org.pdfclown.documents.multimedia.MediaPlayParameters.Viability.PlayerSpecificControl
member.summary: Gets/Sets whether to display a player-specific controller user interface (for example, play/pause/stop controls) when playing.

member.name: P:org.pdfclown.documents.multimedia.MediaPlayParameters.Viability.RepeatCount
member.summary: Gets/Sets the number of iterations of the duration to repeat; similar to SMIL's repeatCount attribute.

member.name: P:org.pdfclown.documents.multimedia.MediaPlayParameters.Viability.Volume
member.summary: Gets/Sets the volume level as a percentage of recorded volume level. A zero value is equivalent to mute.

member.name: P:org.pdfclown.documents.multimedia.MediaPlayParameters.Viability.DurationObject.Value
member.summary: Gets/Sets the temporal duration.

list.item: Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY: intrinsic duration of the associated media;

member.name: F:org.pdfclown.documents.multimedia.MediaPlayParameters.Viability.FitModeEnum.Meet
member.summary: The media's width and height are scaled while preserving the aspect ratio so that the media and play rectangles have the greatest possible intersection while still displaying all media content. Same as meet value of SMIL's fit attribute.

member.name: F:org.pdfclown.documents.multimedia.MediaPlayParameters.Viability.FitModeEnum.Slice
member.summary: The media's width and height are scaled while preserving the aspect ratio so that the play rectangle is entirely filled, and the amount of media content that does not fit within the play rectangle is minimized. Same as slice value of SMIL's fit attribute.

member.name: F:org.pdfclown.documents.multimedia.MediaPlayParameters.Viability.FitModeEnum.Fill
member.summary: The media's width and height are scaled independently so that the media and play rectangles are the same; the aspect ratio is not necessarily preserved. Same as fill value of SMIL's fit attribute.

member.name: F:org.pdfclown.documents.multimedia.MediaPlayParameters.Viability.FitModeEnum.Scroll
member.summary: The media is not scaled. A scrolling user interface is provided if the media rectangle is wider or taller than the play rectangle. Same as scroll value of SMIL's fit attribute.

member.name: F:org.pdfclown.documents.multimedia.MediaPlayParameters.Viability.FitModeEnum.Default
member.summary: Use the player's default setting (author has no preference).

member.name: T:org.pdfclown.documents.multimedia.SoftwareIdentifier
member.summary: Software identifier [PDF:1.7:9.1.6].

member.name: P:org.pdfclown.documents.multimedia.SoftwareIdentifier.OSes
member.summary: Gets the operating system identifiers that indicate which operating systems this object applies to.
member.remarks: The defined values are the same as those defined for SMIL 2.0's systemOperatingSystem attribute. An empty list is considered to represent all operating systems.

member.name: P:org.pdfclown.documents.multimedia.SoftwareIdentifier.URI
member.summary: Gets the URI that identifies a piece of software.
member.remarks: It is interpreted according to its scheme; the only presently defined scheme is vnd.adobe.swname. The scheme name is case-insensitive; if is not recognized by the viewer application, the software must be considered a non-match. The syntax of URIs of this scheme is "vnd.adobe.swname:" software_name where software_name is equivalent to reg_name as defined in Internet RFC 2396, Uniform Resource Identifiers (URI): Generic Syntax.

member.name: P:org.pdfclown.documents.multimedia.SoftwareIdentifier.Version
member.summary: Gets the software version bounds.

member.name: T:org.pdfclown.documents.interchange.access.LanguageIdentifier
member.summary: Language identifier [PDF:1.7:10.8.1][RFC 3066].

remarks.para: Language identifiers can be based on codes defined by the International Organization for Standardization in ISO 639 (language code) and ISO 3166 (country code) or registered with the Internet Assigned Numbers Authority (IANA), or they can include codes created for private use.
A language identifier consists of a primary code optionally followed by one or more subcodes (each preceded by a hyphen).
